lines.text: I do know that for the sympathy of one living being, I would make peace with all. I have love in me the likes of which you can scarcely imagine and rage the likes of which you would not believe. If I cannot satisfy the one, I will indulge the other.
What kind of people is it in which I am comprised? Good people? Bad people?
Materials. Nothing more.
You're wrong.
[Picks up recorder]

Did you know I knew how to play this? From which part of me did this knowledge reside? From this mind? From these hands? From this heart? And reading and speaking. Not so much things learned as things remembered.
Slight trace waves in the brain perhaps.
Did you ever consider the consequences of your actions? You made me, and you left me to die. Who am I?
You? I don't know.
And you think that I am evil.
You gave me these emotions, but you didn't tell me how to use them. Now two people are dead because of us. Why?
There was something at work in my soul which I do not understand.
And what of my soul? Do I have one? Or was that a part you left out?
[Walton finds the Creature weeping over Frankenstein's body]
Who are you?
He never gave me a name.
[he continues to weep]
Why do you weep?
He was my father.
It's alive. It's alive!
And I'm frightened that if I tell you the truth, I'll lose you.
You'll lose me if you don't.
You do speak!
Yes, I speak, and read, and think, and know the ways of men.
Do you share my madness?
No, not madness.
What, then?
There is a passage to the North Pole. And I will find it!
At the cost of your own life and the lives of your own crew?
Lives come and go. If we succeed, our names will live on forever. I will be hailed as the benefactor of our species.
You're wrong. I of all men know that.
I am done with man.
If you deny me my wedding night... I shall be with you on yours!
Why don't you look where I'm going?
I'm here to become a mere doctor. I'm told that has something to do with healing the sick, which is a pity really, because I find sick people rather revolting.
I keep my promises.
I'd keep my promises if I were you.

[voiceover]
You fool, Victor Frankenstein of Geneva, how could you know what you had unleashed? How was it pieced together? Bits of thieves? Bits of murderers? Evil stitched to evil stitched to evil. God help your loved ones.
I will have revenge! FRANKENSTEIN!
Who are you?
My name... is Victor... FRANKENSTEIN
Don't bother to scream.
Promise? Promise? Oh, don't dare use that word to me!
I haven't got time to argue!
Oh, isn't it convenient? Or doesn't it fit in with your plans? Don't you ever think of anything or anyone than yourself?
